SENT.plain: Neck bruits were noticed 86 times in 60 patients
A hemodynamic obstruction of the carotid artery was diagnosed in 22% by Doppler sonography of the supratrochlear artery
The diagnostic directions in case of neck bruits are suggested: 1
In patients with a history of neurological symptoms a pathological Doppler test will be the indication for cerebral angiography
If obstruction of the carotid artery is suspected by clinical examination cerebral angiography should be done in spite of a normal directional Doppler sonography
Cerebral angiography must be done in patients with asymptomatic neck bruits and a pathological Doppler sonography if the patient will undergo a great operation
